snippet: At the Republican Convention in Connecticut, Tom Foley won 57 percent of the delegates’ votes, but two other candidates also earned at least 15 percent of the votes, enough to force a primary.
abstract: Connecticut gubernatorial hopeful Tom Foley wins 57 percent of delegates' votes at state Republican Convention in Connecticut, but Mayor Mark D Boughton of Danbury and State Senate minority leader John McKinney also get enough votes to force a primary.
lead_paragraph: At the Republican Convention in Connecticut, Tom Foley won 57 percent of the delegates’ votes, but two other candidates also earned at least 15 percent of the votes, enough to force a primary.

headline.main: In Connecticut, Republicans Face Primary in Race to Unseat Governor
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Race for Top Post in Hartford Faces Runoff
